Index.name: Xiaoxiao Wu
Index.title: Distinguished Researcher, Doctoral Supervisor, Associate Professor
Index.aboutText: I am a freestyle researcher who works following my own interests. My research is rooted in deep mathematical foundations, such as probability statistics, stochastic signal processing, and optimization theory. I was engaged in communication system-related work in my early years and have a very solid foundation in the field of electronic engineering. After that, I moved to the field of distributed networks and conducted research on distributed computing, distributed networks, and social networks. In recent years, I have conducted different types of research topics in the fields of computer vision, privacy computing, blockchain networks, and AI large models. All the above research was led by myself. I hope that my students will be interested in their own research projects, have strong self-motivation, learn basic skills in my research group, and have the potential to expand their interests in any related fields. The world is big, the unknown is huge, exploration is the meaning of it all.
Index.recruitmentText:
We are recruiting postdoctoral students, and doctoral students in social networks and artificial intelligence are preferred.

Every year we recruit undergraduate interns, master students, and doctoral students. If you are interested in data mining in social networks and artificial intelligence related technologies, you are welcome to contact me. Our graduates will go to ByteDance, NetEase, Huawei, and other major companies.
